context_of_use: This use case provides doctors with mobile access to hospital management functionalities and electronic medical record integration for mobile-collected data.
stakeholders_and_interests: doctor: Access to hospital management functionalities on mobile devices.
description: This use case allows doctors to integrate mobile devices with electronic medical records and use the hospital management system on mobile devices.
triggering_event: Doctor initiates the use of the mobile hospital system.
preconditions: Doctor is authenticated in the hospital management system.
postconditions: Doctor can access hospital management functionalities on the mobile device.
Data collected on mobile devices is stored centrally.
assumptions: The hospital management system supports mobile access.
The mobile device is compatible with the hospital management system.
requirements_met: The system shall allow doctors to integrate mobile devices with electronic medical records.
The system shall provide mobile access to hospital management functionalities.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific functionalities available on mobile devices.
main_flow: 1. Doctor integrates mobile devices with electronic medical records → System stores data collected on mobile devices centrally.
2. Doctor uses the hospital management system on a mobile device → System provides access to hospital management functionalities.
3. Doctor accesses hospital management functionalities → System displays the same functionalities as on a personal computer.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): If the doctor needs to schedule appointments, the system allows access to the schedule appointments functionality.
AF-2 (from Step 3): If the doctor needs to record clinical encounter data, the system allows access to the record clinical encounter data functionality.
AF-3 (from Step 3): If the doctor needs to manage prescriptions, the system allows access to the manage prescriptions functionality.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the integration fails, the system notifies the doctor of the failure and suggests troubleshooting steps.
